explanation:
OS_ObjectIdGetById - Direct callee of OS_CondVarWait; its implementation may contain for-loops or call other functions that do. To check MISRA well-formedness you must inspect its loop clauses and any loop counters used/modified.
OS_ObjectIdTransactionInit - Transitive callee of OS_ObjectIdGetById; include to inspect for loops or side-effecting expressions that affect loop control.
OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex - Transitive callee of OS_ObjectIdGetById; likely to contain index/loop logic (loop counters or conditions) that must be checked against the rule.
OS_ObjectIdConvertToken - Transitive callee of OS_ObjectIdGetById; may manipulate tokens/indexes used in loops; inspect for loop usage and side-effects.
OS_ObjectIdTransactionCancel - Transitive callee of OS_ObjectIdGetById; include to ensure no loops there violate the clause constraints or modify loop counters in bodies.
OS_CondVarWait_Impl - Direct callee (called when ObjectIdGetById succeeds); its body may contain for-loops or call other routines that do — must be inspected for well-formedness and allowed modifications.
OS_ObjectIndexFromToken - Transitive callee of OS_CondVarWait_Impl; include because it may participate in loop control (index calculations) or contain loops itself.
OS_object_token_t - Type of the token variable passed into OS_CondVarWait_Impl/used by ObjectId routines; needed to understand whether objects passed to loops are modified or used as loop counters/flags.
osal_id_t - Type of the var_id parameter; include to understand integer width/sign for any loops using IDs as counters or indices.
int32 - Return type used in the function; include to interpret loop counter types and ensure type-consistent analysis per MISRA rules.
OS_LOCK_MODE_NONE - Macro/enum argument passed to OS_ObjectIdGetById; include to confirm it does not expand to an expression with side-effects that could affect loop clauses.
OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONDVAR - Macro/enum argument passed to OS_ObjectIdGetById; include for the same reason as OS_LOCK_MODE_NONE.
OS_SUCCESS - Return-code constant compared after OS_ObjectIdGetById; include to understand control-flow (whether OS_CondVarWait_Impl is invoked) when analyzing reachable loops.

Notes: The listed symbols are the direct and transitive callees (and relevant types/constants) reachable from OS_CondVarWait according to the static call graph. To determine MISRA "for loop shall be well-formed" compliance you must inspect the bodies of these functions (and any further callees discovered) for for-statements, their three clauses, loop counters, and any side-effects on objects used in the loop clauses or modified in loop bodies.
